before: My name is Ayedh and I grew up east of Anbar Fallujah and I displaced from Anbar to Erbil in 2014. After high school I studied computer science and information technology then worked in iraqi ministry of education for a few years.
joined: While I was studying and while I was working I found that I was always interested in coding and trying to learn it in my spare time. After 1 year from displacement, I decided it was time to change my life and  improve my programing skills and I signed up to go to the Re:Coded Program in Erbil because itâ€™s the best program can help me to achieve my goals.
after: Learning to program is still lots of fun and one of the best decisions I've ever made.
